detail.content: Topics in Cuban Culture: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Topics in Cuban Culture   Fall 2015 OART-951 | 6 units  Class Schedule: Tuesday & Thursday 4-6:00pm    This course is open to all NYU sophomores, juniors and seniors. Students must have a minimum 3.0 grade point average (GPA). Topics in Cuban Culture provides a multifaceted exploration of Cuban history, culture and society from the period of Spanish colonialism, through the wars of independence and the Revolution, and into the "special period" of the 1990s, all the way to the present day. This course is offered in collaboration with the Ludwig Foundation of Cuba, the Cuban National Institute of Film and Television (ICAIC), and the University of Havana. The class will be composed of three parts: (i) the class seminar/recitation, (ii) the study trip, and (iii) final project presentations. Weekly class sessions are in New York and there is a one-week study trip to Cuba during winter break (exact dates to be announced) with visits to Havana, Trinidad and Cienfuegos. Through guest lectures, screenings, workshops and discussions, students will engage the arts and culture of Cuba, paying particular attention to topics such as Afro-Cuban identity, architecture, film, dance, photography, music, Santeria, theatre and politics. The class will also be able to take advantage of local exhibits, performances, theatre, film, and other cultural events current during the spring. On the study trip, students will have an opportunity to experience life in Cuba and to interact with leading Cuban artists, writers, performers and scholars. Students are expected to keep a weekly journal with entries relating to assigned readings and guest lecturers. The final research paper and presentation is on an approved theme. Note: The course has a nonrefundable program fee which covers airfare, accommodations, some meals and all program related activities. The fee is to be announced. Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Havana, Cuba   Follow Us:         Tweet         Tisch School of the Arts developed this one-of-a-kind program in collaboration with the Ludwig Foundation of Cuba, the Cuban National Institute of Film and Television (ICAIC), and the University of Havana. It offers students the rare chance to create art forms and witness the   process of creating art in a unique environment. Study Abroad: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs > Study Abroad        Study Abroad   Follow Us:          Tweet      Tisch Study Abroad programs offer specialized, advanced-level training in a variety of arts disciplines and meet the same standards of excellence as our programs in New York. Beyond the classroom, student activities include field trips, performances, and interaction with professional artists.     Academic Year: BERLIN, GERMANY • Stanislavsky, Brecht and Beyond: An Integrated Approach to Actor Training  HAVANA, CUBA • Documentary Video Production in Havana • Photography: On Location in Havana LONDON, ENGLAND   • Shakespeare in Performance at RADA • Playwriting in London • Screenwriting in London PRAGUE, CZECH REPUBLIC   • 35mm Directing in Prague SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA • Producing and Screenwriting in Sydney           Summer:    AMSTERDAM, THE NETHERLANDS   • International Theatre Workshop in Amsterdam BERLIN, GERMANY   • Multimedia Projects Workshop FLORENCE, ITALY   • Commedia dell’Arte in Florence • Writing in Florence  HAVANA, CUBA   • Dance and Culture in Havana   • Photography: On Location in Havana LONDON, ENGLAND   • Producing in London • Introduction to Television Writing PARIS, FRANCE   • Experimental Production Workshop PRAGUE, CZECH REPUBLIC   • 35mm Filmmaking in Prague • Contemporary Design: Prague Quadrennial Festival                             Request Information 2015-16 Tisch Special Programs Admissions Calendar Scholarships and Financial Aid for Study Abroad Study Abroad Alumni Quote Book Subscribe to the Tisch Special Programs Blog Tisch Representation: Global Network University  Study Abroad Brochure (pdf)  Fall/Spring Study Abroad Programs FAQ Summer Study Abroad Programs FAQ  Office of Special Programs 721 Broadway, 12th Floor New York, NY 10003  Contact us!
